fields.summary: CloudFormation waitcondition handle url should use hostname not IP

status.name: Confirmed

fields.description: *Assessment* When testing out a template based upon the [AWS Cloudformation example of using WaitConditions with instances|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/quickref-cloudformation.html#d0e17397] on Shared Setup 1 (which now has HTTPS endpoints), I noticed the following output: {code} [root@d-01 ~]# euform-describe-stack-resources -n WaitConditionTest --region devops-admin@shared-setup-1RESOURCE myWaitCondition AWS::CloudFormation::WaitCondition CREATE_IN_PROGRESS RESOURCE myWaitHandle http://objectstorage.c-04.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com:8773/cf-waitcondition-mefbuetwikrnq/arn%3Aaws%3Acloudformation%3A%3A001520216600%3Astack/WaitConditionTest/0c647b35-fe7f-4cdc-adbe-34733708937e/myWaitHandle/WaitHandle?Expires=1450147373&AWSAccessKeyId=AKIAB5SC6S7D4SYRCHUT&x-amz-security-token=ZXVjYQABcPFmSJYJxHG%2ByjDDadS1LfUPZjMg7cqVSKpTX8VF%2F%2BiQiFsRpqS%2Buerk6ugwLbv3wHcAnhjb%2BcCvON5TYGSSQElankKIOW48Z%2FbnmeszOCieLopTxGt9%2FxkD2F3Y%2Ft2ZVf8h267d%2FGnAU82eyu5XCXL87Hji2hpQkXtS1QTRKTO98oNde6ghcqJsVnk8cCXKjpQw9fNE9fHkcYJ3vL%2FbnWn%2FDA36cg6fZp3ZDrxG%2BEm50YuIz%2BHl%2B6s%3D&Signature=zd0oWKZ44%2BswLQCY5t%2FakFuSvCc%3D AWS::CloudFormation::WaitConditionHandle CREATE_COMPLETE RESOURCE Ec2Instance i-cb9036fd AWS::EC2::Instance CREATE_COMPLETE {code} A couple of things that were noticed here: # The stack resource {{myWaitHandle}} points to an HTTP location on OSG, rather than the configured HTTPS endpoint. # When accessing the handle data (using HTTPS and removing ':8773') from within the instance, the following message was contained in JSON returned: {code} ubuntu@euca-10-111-73-99:~$ curl 'https://objectstorage.c-04.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/cf-waitcondition-mefbuetwikrnq/arn%3Aaws%3Acloudformation%3A%3A001520216600%3Astack/WaitConditionTest/b0a47a31-6d0d-490f-a267-c87c30c22df1/myWaitHandle/WaitHandle?Expires=1450153583&AWSAccessKeyId=AKIABYBPMSJ6BXFFOFXX&x-amz-security-token=ZXVjYQAB6wonPsHzdVO9CCO7coHVtO2sKdKKzleuq%2Fk5X6mq7twTUy4J8mKUrGFYUL9iHQVwESuCYJabcQ6f7Hn2SixmB88tW%2FZckwNs0j4bhpWFxqZjkzz9EO5rSbjvdFo%2BnepDvnQgvpv6Pq%2Fqu6%2BCj%2FNIa0gOnwyzodPyJsZUrfLU4BsA1aW46gk%2FlyGKwks3bpp%2FwUhJBvxY7TnsxCwcYocPQIBgShQ2E43aMPNAEB85QICpC%2FMbr%2BMNum0%3D&Signature=1X2KucVtT9INNoKJiFCBuhJCeDo%3D' -k AccessDeniedAccess DeniedCould not verify request The request signature we calculated does not match the signature you provided.f3f7d5c5-6dbb-4939-90db-eee1ae61de51 {code} *Additional Information* * Template used on Shared Setup 1 is attached * Template used [Ubuntu Trusty HVM EMI|http://cloud-images.ubuntu.com/trusty/current/trusty-server-cloudimg-amd64-disk1.img]
fields.summary: WaitCondition Handle Incorrect on HTTPS Endpoint Cloud

comments.body: A few solutions available. We need to decide how to approach it.

[~hspencer], the signature mismatch probably comes from the fact that you're using the wrong HTTP verb with CURL. The verb is part of the signature and for a WaitCondition. The AWS doc you reference uses a 'curl -T /tmp/a', so it is doing a PUT of the file. The pre-signed URL is meant for PUT only, not GET, so it is expected not to work in that case.

Did this cause failures? The signature shouldn't care about HTTPs or 8773. We need to handle that correctly, but it shouldn't cause failures of the waitcondition to function.

[~zhill],

Yea, I got a failure using the 'curl -T /tmp/a' as well.  I will try again on Shared Setup 1, and update the ticket to show the results.
Was it the same auth failure (signature mismatch), or something else?

[~zhill],

Actually, the deployment fails.  
{code}
# euform-describe-stacks --region devops-admin@shared-setup-1
STACK	WaitConditionTest	ROLLBACK_COMPLETE		Cloudformation template to demonstrate Wait Conditions	2016-01-14T17:38:01.158Z
PARAMETER	EMImageId		emi-ea5885b7
PARAMETER	UserKeyPair		devops-admin
{code}
Looks like the wait condition failed to create:
{code}

I SSH'd into the instance and created the /tmp/a file as mentioned in the steps.
{code}
ubuntu@euca-10-111-73-25:~$ cat /tmp/a
{
  "Status" : "SUCCESS",
  "Reason" : "Configuration Complete",
  "UniqueId" : "ID1234",
